1.text: For I would not have you ignorant, brethren, that all our fathers were under the cloud, and all passed through the sea;

2.text: and all were baptised unto Moses in the cloud and in the sea;

3.text: and all ate the same spiritual food,

4.text: and all drank the same spiritual drink, for they drank of a spiritual rock which followed [them]: (now the rock was the Christ;)

5.text: yet God was not pleased with the most of them, for they were strewed in the desert.

6.text: But these things happened [as] types of us, that we should not be lusters after evil things, as they also lusted.

7.text: Neither be ye idolaters, as some of them; as it is written, The people sat down to eat and to drink, and rose up to play.

8.text: Neither let us commit fornication, as some of them committed fornication, and fell in one day three and twenty thousand.

9.text: Neither let us tempt the Christ, as some of them tempted, and perished by serpents.

10.text: Neither murmur ye, as some of them murmured, and perished by the destroyer.

11.text: Now all these things happened to them [as] types, and have been written for our admonition, upon whom the ends of the ages are come.

12.text: So that let him that thinks that he stands take heed lest he fall.

13.text: No temptation has taken you but such as is according to man’s nature; and God is faithful, who will not suffer you to be tempted above what ye are able [to bear], but will with the temptation make the issue also, so that [ye] should be able to bear [it].

14.text: Wherefore, my beloved, flee from idolatry.

15.text: I speak as to intelligent [persons]: do ye judge what I say.

16.text: The cup of blessing which we bless, is it not [the] communion of the blood of the Christ? The bread which we break, is it not [the] communion of the body of the Christ?

17.text: Because we, [being] many, are one loaf, one body; for we all partake of that one loaf.

18.text: See Israel according to flesh: are not they who eat the sacrifices in communion with the altar?

19.text: What then do I say? that what is sacrificed to an idol is anything, or that an idol is anything?

20.text: But that what [the nations] sacrifice they sacrifice to demons, and not to God. Now I do not wish you to be in communion with demons.

21.text: Ye cannot drink [the] Lord’s cup, and [the] cup of demons: ye cannot partake of [the] Lord’s table, and of [the] table of demons.

22.text: Do we provoke the Lord to jealousy? are we stronger than he?

23.text: All things are lawful, but all are not profitable; all things are lawful, but all do not edify.

24.text: Let no one seek his own [advantage], but that of the other.

25.text: Everything sold in the shambles eat, making no inquiry for conscience sake.

26.text: For the earth [is] the Lord’s and its fulness.

27.text: But if any one of the unbelievers invite you, and ye are minded to go, all that is set before you eat, making no inquiry for conscience sake.

28.text: But if any one say to you, This is offered to holy purposes, do not eat, for his sake that pointed it out, and conscience sake;

29.text: but conscience, I mean, not thine own, but that of the other: for why is my liberty judged by another conscience?

30.text: If I partake with thanksgiving, why am I spoken evil of for what I give thanks for?

31.text: Whether therefore ye eat, or drink, or whatever ye do, do all things to God’s glory.

32.text: Give no occasion to stumbling, whether to Jews, or Greeks, or the assembly of God.

33.text: Even as I also please all in all things; not seeking my own profit, but that of the many, that they may be saved.
